intro: Bauhinia claviflora, commonly known as the flame tree, is a deciduous leguminous shrub or small tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling flames. The plant has bipinnate leaves composed of numerous small leaflets, and its flowers are typically arranged in racemose inflorescences. Bauhinia claviflora thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun for optimal growth. It is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen through its root nodules, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
